Describe the size of the second largest component of the random graph on $n$ vertices, where each edge is included independently with probability $1/n$.



Erd\H{o}s believed that almost surely the second largest component has size $\ll \log n$. This is true, as proved by Koml\'{o}s, Sulyok, and Szemer\'{e}di \cite{KSS80}.




References


[KSS80] Koml\'{o}s, J. and Sulyok, M. and Szemer\'{e}di, E., Second largest component in a random graph. Studia Sci. Math. Hungar. (1980), 391-395.
